intro: Coccoloba microstachya var. ovalifolia, commonly known as the oval-leaf beautyberry, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America, typically growing in moist, shaded environments. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or white. Its fruits are bright purple berries that mature in the fall, attracting various bird species. The plant is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits in native landscapes.
